value.title: Create a knowledge store with Azure Cognitive Search
value.excerpt: Learn how to persist the output from an Azure Cognitive Search enrichment pipeline for independent analysis or downstream processing.

value.title: Create your first Azure IoT Central app
value.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. The first unit creates the app, the second unit defines a device template for a refrigerated truck. Then, create a programming project, add code to simulate a truck, and communicate with your IoT Central app. The truck is monitored through a custom dashboard.

value.title: Create data-driven websites by using Django
value.excerpt: Use Django to create data-driven websites.

topItems.title: Get started with Django
topItems.excerpt: Django is one of the most popular Python web frameworks. Explore its benefits, learn how to install it, and create your first project.

topItems.title: Work with models and data in Django
topItems.excerpt: Explore models and data in Django. Learn about the object-relational mapper, create your own models, and set up a database.

topItems.title: Work with the Django admin site
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to set up the built-in Django admin site and configure users for the site.

topItems.title: Create views and templates in Django
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the templating engine in Django to create dynamic HTML. In this module, you'll create views and use template variables, inheritance, and tags.

value.title: Introduction to Azure Cognitive Search
value.excerpt: Explore Azure Cognitive Search to discover how to create an index, import data, and query the index for better search results.

value.title: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app with Azure Static Web Apps
value.excerpt: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app with Azure Static Web Apps. Use Visual Studio Code to create and run the web app locally.

value.title: Publish a Blazor WebAssembly app and .NET API with Azure Static Web Apps
value.excerpt: Publish a Blazor WebAssembly app and .NET API with Azure Static Web Apps

value.title: Transform your business applications with fusion development
value.excerpt: Fusion development allows your business to build better applications, faster by bringing together professional developers with citizen, or low-code, developers. This learning path will teach you how a fusion development team functions, introduce low-code concepts for professional developers, and explain how a professional developer can enable their citizen developer counterparts to build amazing Power Apps applications using pro-code tools and frameworks they're already familiar and comfortable with, like JavaScript, ASP.NET Core web APIs, and Azure API Management.

topItems.title: Integrate OpenAPI-enabled Web APIs with Azure API Management through Visual Studio
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to add an OpenAPI-enabled Web API application to Azure API Management through Visual Studio.

value.title: Integrate OpenAPI-enabled Web APIs with Azure API Management through Visual Studio
value.excerpt: Learn how to add an OpenAPI-enabled Web API application to Azure API Management through Visual Studio.

value.title: Decompose a monolithic application into a microservices architecture
value.excerpt: Improve development agility, deployment, fault tolerance, and scalability by modernizing your application with a microservices architecture.

value.title: Choose an Azure service for deploying your Java application
value.excerpt: In this tutorial, you'll learn about running your Java applications on Azure, and choose the best option between Virtual Machines, Azure App Services, Serverless functions, Kubernetes and Azure Spring Cloud.

value.title: Migrate an on-premises web application to Azure App Service
value.excerpt: Use the Azure App Service Migration Assistant to assess the readiness of a web app to be deployed on App Service, and perform the migration.

value.title: Create and publish a web application with Azure App Service and Visual Studio Code
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to create and publish webapps to Azure App Service from Visual Studio Code.

value.title: Set up rules and take action on telemetry data in Azure IoT Central
value.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. We build the IoT Central app from a downloaded JSON file, defining all the device capabilities. Source code is also downloaded for the device app. The focus of this module is on creating rules and actions, to respond to certain telemetry input. Rules and actions enable greater automation of an IoT Central system.

value.title: Azure App Service Web Apps | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Byron Tardif joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure App Service Web Apps, the best way to build and host web applications in the programming language of your choice without managing infrastructure. It offers auto-scaling and high availability, supports both Windows and Linux, and enables automated deployments
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jCfJWYocz1M" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Spring Cloud workshop
value.excerpt: In this workshop, you'll go through tasks to deploy Spring Boot microservices to Azure Spring Cloud (ASC).

value.title: Deploy ASP.NET web apps with Azure Pipelines
value.excerpt: Azure Pipelines help automate building, deploying, and maintaining your applications. While they support a wide range of platforms and programming languages, in this module you’ll focus on using them to implement ASP.NET apps on Azure App Service Web Apps with Azure SQL Database as their data store.

value.title: Load test Azure web apps by using Azure DevOps
value.excerpt: Discover Azure portal and Azure DevOps tools that help you quickly and efficiently define and scale up load tests for apps.

value.title: Publish an API to Azure Static Web Apps
value.excerpt: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app and API with Azure Static Web Apps and Azure Functions. Deploy your code from GitHub to a staging site using preview URLs.

value.title: Authenticate users with Azure Static Web Apps
value.excerpt: Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue JavaScript app with API and authentication using Azure Static Web Apps and Azure Functions. Deploy your code from GitHub to a staging site using preview URLs.

value.title: Track global air quality with Azure Maps
value.excerpt: This module shows how you can track global air quality using the Azure Maps Web SDK and pollution data from a third-party air quality API.

value.title: Operational best practices for web apps on Azure App Service | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Azure App Service hosts millions of apps, serves trillions of requests per day, and has an SLA of 99.95%. But what should you do when your app has issues in production? Byron Tardif joins Scott Hanselman to discuss some operational best practices for running your web apps on Azure App Service.  0:00
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JAqoLC2dv-M" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Build serverless, full stack applications in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to create, build, and deploy modern full stack applications in Azure by using the language of your choice (Python, Node.js, or .NET) and with a Vue.js frontend. Topics covered include modern database capabilities, CI/CD and DevOps, backend API development, REST, and more. Using a real-world scenario of trying to catch the bus, you will learn how to build a solution that uses Azure SQL Database, Azure Functions, Azure Static Web Apps, Logic Apps, Visual Studio Code, and GitHub Actions.

topItems.title: Architect modern applications using Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Break down a scenario for an application and build a multi-service solution based on the microservices approach. Learn how to use modern database capabilities to build a foundation for applications.

topItems.title: Deploy serverless APIs with Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: In the language of your choice (Node.js, Python, or .NET), learn how to deploy an Azure Function that adds real-time data to an Azure SQL Database and triggers an Azure Logic App for notifications, all with GitHub Actions for CI/CD.

topItems.title: Architect full-stack applications and automate deployments with GitHub
topItems.excerpt: In the language of your choice (Node.js, Python, or .NET), deploy an end-to-end solution to solve the real-world scenario of catching the bus. You'll learn how to architect a solution that uses Azure SQL Database, Azure Functions, Azure Static Web Apps, Logic Apps, Visual Studio Code, and GitHub Actions.

value.title: Migrate an ASP.NET web application to Azure with Visual Studio
value.excerpt: Migrate an ASP.NET web application to Azure with Visual Studio

topItems.title: Externalize the configuration of an ASP.NET app by using an Azure key vault
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use ConfigurationBuilder to dynamically configure an ASP.NET web app to retrieve secrets from an Azure key vault.

topItems.title: Implement logging in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to implement logging in an ASP.NET web application so you can store log data in Azure Blob storage and incorporate log information into Azure Application Insights performance data.

topItems.title: Improve session scalability in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application by using Azure Cache for Redis
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Cache for Redis to store session data and improve the scalability of web applications.

value.title: Accelerate and scale a Spring Boot application with Azure Cache for Redis
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn what Azure Cache for Redis is, and how to use it with a Java and Spring Boot application. You'll use it to cache some business data using Spring Data Redis, and also to store HTTP session data using Spring Session.

value.title: Work with the Django admin site
value.excerpt: Learn how to set up the built-in Django admin site and configure users for the site.

value.title: Externalize the configuration of an ASP.NET app by using an Azure key vault
value.excerpt: Learn how to use ConfigurationBuilder to dynamically configure an ASP.NET web app to retrieve secrets from an Azure key vault.

value.title: Implement logging in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application
value.excerpt: Learn how to implement logging in an ASP.NET web application so you can store log data in Azure Blob storage and incorporate log information into Azure Application Insights performance data.

value.title: Improve session scalability in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application by using Azure Cache for Redis
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Cache for Redis to store session data and improve the scalability of web applications.

value.title: Architect full-stack applications and automate deployments with GitHub
value.excerpt: In the language of your choice (Node.js, Python, or .NET), deploy an end-to-end solution to solve the real-world scenario of catching the bus. You'll learn how to architect a solution that uses Azure SQL Database, Azure Functions, Azure Static Web Apps, Logic Apps, Visual Studio Code, and GitHub Actions.

value.title: Build a Web App with Refreshable Machine Learning Models
value.excerpt: Build a web app powered by machine learning models trained using Custom Vision AI service, and learn how to refresh them with GitHub Actions.
